cyclone.name: NATE
cyclone.current_location: about 170 miles SSE of Cabo Gracias a Dios on the Nicaragua/Honduras border
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to track northwest across Nicaragua and Honduras, enter the north-western Caribbean, then move northward across the Gulf of Mexico toward the northern Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the MS/AL border just east of the Mississippi River delta (close to the southeast Louisiana coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm warning only in effect from Sandy Bay Sirpi, Nicaragua, to Punta Castilla, Honduras
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same as watch area – Central America (Nicaragua–Honduras coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana eastward to the Florida Panhandle is within the 5-day cone
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph gusts) could reach the lower Mississippi River corridor Sunday afternoon and persist into early Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Elevated water levels of 2–4 ft above normally dry ground possible along the southeast Louisiana coast and lower Mississippi River estuary during Sunday’s onshore flow.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands of 3–6 inches with locally higher totals could affect the port Sunday into Monday, producing localized flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Frequent lightning in outer squalls, hazardous seas and strong rip currents in approaches and anchorages.
